stance_1: I avoid wasting meat out of respect for animals
stance_2: I eat meat most days of the week
justification: Eating meat frequently is paired with a respect for the animal by not wasting meat—these do not conflict and are presented as complementary.

stance_1: I avoid wasting meat out of respect for animals
stance_2: I grew up eating meat in a rural community
justification: Respecting the animal and not wasting meat fits with traditional rural values described by the interviewee.

stance_1: I avoid wasting meat out of respect for animals
stance_2: I believe not every meal needs meat
justification: Not every meal needing meat can reduce waste and aligns with the respect-for-animal stance.

stance_1: I avoid wasting meat out of respect for animals
stance_2: I do not want to be vegetarian or vegan
justification: Not wanting to abstain from meat yet emphasizing respect for the animal suggests a reconciliatory approach, not a conflict.

stance_1: I avoid wasting meat out of respect for animals
stance_2: I eat meatless meals for affordability
justification: Choosing some meatless meals for affordability aligns with a careful, respectful approach to meat.

justification: It is explicitly stated that cost is a reason for eating meatless meals.
